title: Three Papyrus Fragments Inscribed in Demotic
dynasty: Year 23 of Ptolemy III or Year 53 of Ptolemy VIII
description:
Three unrelated fragments of papyri, two of which are inscribed on both sides, written in Demotic.
a: Letter from Mai-resy to Pakhorkhonsu regarding the two burials. The 6 lines of recto are complete; the verso has 1 one containing the name of the addressee.
b: 4 barely legible lines of text written on verso, suggesting either a letter or an 	agreement.
c: Various alternative recipes with ingredients and amounts used for preparing 	ointments. 16 lines of text on the recto and 10 on the verso.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
